segments.text: I worked over the summer at a restaurant . Have to make tuition money , right ? What did you do ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I took summer school . I withdrew from two of my classes last year so I wanted to make them up .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: So are you officially a junior now ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yeah . And I have 5 credits to spare . I only needed to take 10 credits over the summer , but I took 15 because the price was the same .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That makes sense . So where is Nicole ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: She dropped out of school completely .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: She worked at a startup company as an intern and since the business did well , they asked her if she wanted to work full time .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Wow . She's so lucky . She doesn't have a degree and she already has a job .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It sounds good now , but I'm traditional . I want the degree , so I wouldn't have accepted the offer .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Do you know how much they are paying her ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I don't know . But I bet it must have been a good offer , or she wouldn't have accepted it .
segments.speaker: S1
